item.title: Building a Persistent KV Store with B-epsilon Trees
item.description:
Research Notes

I want to build a persistent key-value store based on B-epsilon trees. I looked at LevelDB but it’s written in C++, which isn’t my preference. So I decided to write this in Rust since I haven’t touched it in a while. I’m also a bit tired of Go at this point due to its syntax, error handling, and GC overhead.
